runs.comm: first ball is carefully defended by Kusal Perera, Sunny is the bowler
on the pads this time, clipped towards square leg

dropped, Lasith Malinga puts it down at short fine leg, Shamsur moved across the stumps and swept that, it flew to Malinga's right and he gets his hands on it, but can't latch on, should have been taken
pushed towards cover for a single

Shamsur Rahman, after having survived on the previous ball, perishes this time, slapping a catch to midwicket, straight to the man there, takes a chest-high catch, the move to open with Dilshan pays off, Malinga will be a relieved man
pitched up and on the pads, nudged towards square leg
starts with a pitched-up delivery, well outside off, pushed in front of square on the off side

and another one down, both Bangladesh openers have fallen within eight balls of the start, Tamim skips down the track and moved away from leg stumps, Kula bowls it well outside off, Tamim has to reach across to get to that one, he still tries to force the ball and can't get enough on it, holing out to deep point
Shakib also skips down the track, this time the ball is closer to the batsman's body, Shakib lashes his first ball through extra cover for four
again Shakib comes down the track, drives towards cover
launches this straight over the bowler's head, Shakib begins with a bang here, it was a short of length ball outside off, powered straight back, lands just short of the boundary, four more to Shakib
and another one, three fours in his first four deliveries, this time it is towards deep midiwcket, once more Shakib shimmies down, connects well and that's four more
on the pads, tapped towards square leg
he doesn't come down the pitch like his senior team-mates have today, stays in the crease and lashes that over mid-off for four, lovely inside-out hit
defended this time by Anamul
Anamul is also in a hurry here, he skips down the track and thrashes this over wide long-on for six more, Bangladesh in top gear though they have lost two wickets
moves away a touch from leg side, to provide him the room to free his arms, hammers this over extra cover for four more, the crowd are going wild, as is the Bangladesh run-rate
rounds off the over with a massive hit to wide long-on, all the way for six, and that's 20 runs off the over, wow
Senanayake's first ball is tapped in front of point

a classic catch from Kulasekara at long-on, huge wicket as Shakib is gone, Bangladesh have been scoring almost exclusively in boundaries in this frenetic T20 so far, Shakib can't connect well enough though and Kulasekara takes a screamer of a catch, he sprints back from mid-on, keeps his eyes on the ball, and stretches out to pluck a sensational catch while facing the boundary, tumbles over with the momentum, awesome effort that
length ball on middle, driven towards long-on for a single
length ball on middle and off, clipped towards wide mid-on
defended back towards the bowler to end the over
short of length ball to start from Malinga, on off stump, batsman goes well back in the crease, defended
fuller and on the pads, slower one from Malinga, tucked to the leg side
beaten outside off, Malinga starts with three dot balls, this one nearly took the outside edge
make that four dots in a row, this one wasn't quite on target, down the leg side, the batsman need to just glance that down to fine leg, gets too thin an edge and it bounces through to the keeper
five dots, the batsman losing his mind, and luckily not his wicket, he just charges down and attempts a slog, not the most intelligent cricket on display from Anamul, doesn't connect at well
finally he gets a run in the over, tucks the final ball behind square leg to deny Malinga a maiden
pushed towards cover for a single
length ball on off stump, defended off the front foot towards cover for a sensible single, Bangladesh could do with some more of those

wow! I thought Kula's would be the catch of the series, but it isn't even the catch of the past 15 minutes, here's Kusal Perera with an astonishing, diving take at the boundary, Anamul's all-action innings has come to an end, he struck this powerfully towards deep midwicket, Perera wasn't at the boundary, he took a few paces to his right and had to fling himself to take an overhead catch
defended to the leg side for a single
blocked this time by Sabbir
just three runs off the over, more defence to end the over
short and wide well outside off, slapped hard but straight at backward point
short and wide once more, fiercely struck this time, towards deep point, batsmen sprint back for two
this one stays a little low as Mathews bowls the slower offcutter, a delivery medium-pacers seems to rely heavily on these days, batsman can't connect as he looks to work it to the leg side
pushed towards cover for a single this time
pushed in front of point this time, no run
slanting in towards the pad, nudges it behind point for a single, Nasir wanted two but there wasn't time to take it
pitched up, Nasir uses his feet, coming down to loft the ball towards long-off, a misfield from Senanayake there allows an extra run
steps down the track once more, struck on the pad but he was miles down the track, and the umpire wasn't going to give that

and another one! Nasir holes out to extra cover now, no need for any fielding heroics to get the wicket, this was a simple catch, straight at the man, Chandimal didn't have to move, Nasir Hossain will have to move to the pavilion
full ball on the pads, Mahmudullah blocks it to the leg side
spins in after pitching just outside off, driven towards extra cover
on the pads, guides it down towards fine leg, fine enough to get two
short of length ball is calmly tucked towards square leg for a single
a touch short, Mahmudullah isn't going to stop playing his shots, he powers this past midwicket for four, at that length Mathews is easy to put away
shorter this time, Mahmudullah decides to duck under it
short once more, well outside off, goes for the cut and is beaten
gets bat on it this time, glanced towards fine leg for a single, working it with the angle
length ball on off stump, opens the face to steer the ball towards point
outside off, defended towards point
drives this towards sweeper cover for a single
flighted and outside off, sabbir watches that closely as he lets it through to the keeper
goes for the sweep this time, sends it towards short fine leg where Malinga fields
worked towards deep square leg for a single, sensibly stuff this
sends this towards midwicket for one more, a rare calm passage of play this
Kula sends it a touch short as the batsman steps out of the crease well before the ball is bowled, defended
digs it in short there, Shabbir decides to duck under it

oh dear, comical running here from Bangladesh, if the crazy shots weren't enough, now both batsmen are at the same end when Mahmudullah is run out, Sabbit taps the ball towards point and takes a couple of paces down the track, Mahmudullah starts sprinting, Sabbir stops, and Mahmudullah has no chance of returning, Dilshan doesn't even need to throw, he runs in to take off the bails

whoah, could have been another run-out there, guided down to fine leg, Bangladesh decide there is time for two, but Farhad Reza wasn't at his quickest coming back and the throw from the deep passes the stumps with Reza well out of the stumps, Kulasekara doesn't collect the ball as he think it might hit the stumps direct, luckily for Reza it doesn't
Sennaykae is back, starts with a length ball on middle and leg, defended
guided towards backward point, another dot ball
blocked to the off side this time
length ball spinning in and that's the fourth dot ball of the over now, blocked to the leg side
length ball outside off, opens the face and he steers it past slip, Malinga gives chase, can he get there in there? he does, just before the ball reaches the rope, three runs
goes for the sweep and there's an lbw appeal, the umpire is less interested than the Sri Lankans
Mendis begins the over with a wide down the leg side

that could have been another wicket, a thick inside edge luckily for the batsman flies past the stumps, races down to fine leg where Angelo Perera gets his foot down in time to stop the ball from reaching the rope
defended towards point this time
wider outside off, wanted to cut that forcefully but then decides to play it softly towards backward point
short and on the pads, nudges it towards square leg, no run, Shabbir should have done better than that there
blocked back towards the bowler
looks to whip it to the leg side after skipping down the track, the ball pops to the off side after hitting the pad
this one ghosts past the outside edge after pitching just outside off, did it brush the back pad after beating the edge, yes it did, two leg byes towards third man
defended back towards the bowler
skips down the track and that is blocked back to the bowler
tossed up, pitching well outside off and spins in sharply as the batsman defends awkwardly
moves across outside off, clipped behind square leg for a single
pushed towards cover for a single
speared in towards the pads, batsman can't get bat on it but he sneaks a leg-bye
fuller this time and a single results towards midwicket

goes for the big hit, somehow that doesn't result in a catch, that was a short ball that was top-edged towards deep square leg, three men close in on it but it somehow eludes them all and lands near the square leg boundary
defended towards point for a single
short ball and just outside off, left alone, Kule thought it was a dot ball, but the umpire deemed it too high, Kule smiles as he walks past the umpire, asking him whether that was that high
now he has reason to smile, Reza gifts away his wicket, chipping a catch to short cover, and Bangladesh have lost their seventh, nothing dangerous about the delivery, but it results in a wicket
Mortaza begins with a thrash through extra cover for four, will Bangladesh last through till the end of 20 overs?
short of length ball on off stump, defended towards cover
fuller one is nudged towards square leg for a single
full and just outside off, Mashrafe backs away from the stumps, then jams the bat down as he decides against going for an expansive stroke through the off
length ball on off stump, Mashrafe not too eager to get behind the line of Malinga's bowling, he pushes this towards cover for a single
full ball heading for the base of middle stump, it was a slower one as well, defended towards mid-on for a single
yet another big hit attempted, yet again it doesn't come off, results in four this time though, the big swipe results in a bottom edge that zooms past lg stump and the keeper for four
guides the ball towards backward point and sets off, send back by the non-striker
short and wide outside off, batsman decides the best way to deal with that is to swat it to midwicket, gets a single for his efforts
goes for the reverse sweep this, looking to guide it past the keeper, doesn't connect
a tailender's slog from Mashrafe, almost falls over with the effort, again doesn't connect
muscles this towards the square-leg boundary, Mashrafe doesn't want to hang out, he wants boundaries, and he gets it this time

and that back-to-back boundaries, the previous one was a slog, this is off a top edge as he looks to slug it to the leg side, the ball flies away past the keeper, the hundred i up and the crowd cheers wildly
slower one, on the pads, eased towards deep square leg
more bonafide tailender batting, Mashrafe backs away from the stumps and aims at cow corner, this was full and past the leg stump

the perfect yorker from Malinga, it didn't need as good a ball as that to dismiss Mashrafe given the way he was batting, this time he has moved away miles from the leg stump, he struggles to t reach this yorker which clatters into the base of middle stump
worked towards square leg for a single
slower length ball on off stump, driven back at the bowler
there's his first boundary, this one is launched over the bowler's head for four, good hit from Sabbir

angles it outside off, past the outside edge and through to the keeper, they decide to pinch a bye, Sanga fires in the throw at the non-striker's end but the ball strikes Sunny on his back as he races through, Sri Lanka appeal for obstructing the field, but he didn't change his line of running so he's safe
short and down the leg side, helped away to the deep backward-leg boundary , sabbir getting a move on
a misfield by Kusal at sweeper cover allows a second, that was a full toss from Kulasekara
driven towards long-off for a single
swipes and misses, that one angles away past the outside edge
again no contact, past the outside edge to end the over with two dot balls
Lasith begins the over with a short one, umpire calls it a wide on height, the right call from the umpire
a loopy full toss, the slower one is swiped towards midwicket
full and on the pads, Suuny manages to get a bit of bat on that, not quite off the middle but it runs away very fine to the fine-leg boundary
slower one from Malinga, far too good for Sunny, who can only lob a catch to Chandimal at mid-on, easy catch there, the fourth for Chandimal
superb yorker from Malinga there, somehow squeezed out to the leg side

length ball outside off, and another smart catch ends this innings, this was sliced towards deep point, Kulasekara takes a low catch after moving in from the rope, Sri Lanka have been superb in the field today, Bangladsh are all out for 120
